DOC.detailed_description: The Coronary Artery Risk Development Young Adults ( CARDIA ) Study prospective , epidemiologic investigation determinant evolution cardiovascular risk factor among 5,115 African American white young middle age adult 18-30 year age baseline 1985-86 . Participants recruit population four geographic location ( Birmingham , AL ; Chicago , IL ; Minneapolis , MN ; Oakland , CA ) . The study population approximately balance accord sex ( 54 % woman ) , ethnicity ( 52 % African American ) , education ( 40 % less equal 12 year education ) center ( Friedman ) . After 1984 baseline , additional examination undertake year 2 ( 1987-88 ) , 5 ( 1990-91 ) , 7 ( 1992-93 ) , 10 ( 1995-96 ) , 15 ( 2000-01 ) 20 ( 2005-06 ) . To date , 72 % total baseline cohort still active study . Based 20 year follow-up , longitudinal data cohort provide clear evidence increase prevalence many cardiovascular risk factor , include obesity diabetes . Therefore , study present ideal unique opportunity study change cardiovascular risk factor begin age hypothesize may critical determine future trajectory brain disease . Furthermore , trend CV-RF reflect general trend US population . Thus , CARDIA participant ideal study cohort reflect characteristic next generation old person . This ancillary study MRI-evident neurodegenerative vascular brain change subset 719 CARDIA participant participate Year 25 Exam . Specifically , study relation time length exposure level cardiovascular risk factor presence sub-clinical brain lesion cognitive impairment . Participants recruit CARDIA field sit Birmingham , AL ( PI : Cora E. Lewis , MD , MSPH- University Lalbama , Nirmingham ) , Minneapolis , MN ( PI : Pamela Schreiner , PhD , MS- University Minnesota ) Oakland , CA ( PI : Steve Sidney , MD , mPH- Kaiser Permanente ) .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : A qualified participant CARDIA trial MRI contraindication . EXCLUSION CRITERIA : Participants know contraindication MRI examination exclude study ( severe claustrophobia , pacemaker , defibrillator , neurostimulator , ferromagnetic aneurysm clip unknown , 3T MR incompatible metal implant kind foreign metal object body bullet , shrapnel , metal sliver , etc ) . Any female participant childbearing age test negative pregnancy test prior schedule MRI exam also exclude participation Brain MRI Substudy .
